p: A significant interaction between invasion and habitat was found for OM content (F 1,50 = 4.74, p = 0.0341), indicating that the effect of invasion was habitat type-dependent ( Table 2). In semi-natural grasslands, S. gigantea-invaded plots had a higher OM content as compared to uninvaded plots (F 1,50 = 8.12, p = 0.0063; Table 3, Figure 1), whereas no difference in OM content was detected between plot-pairs at riparian sites. It should be noted that determining OM content by weight loss as used here might have overestimated the OM% for the riparian samples with a high clay content [ 41].
